intro: Cacalia tricephala, commonly known as the three-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with a bell-shaped structure that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cacalia tricephala is often found in rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
